intro: Eschscholzia diversiloba, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, oval-shaped fruits called capsules. Eschscholzia diversiloba is an important species for pollinators and is considered a rare, endemic plant.
